instructions.name: init_buddylink_buddy_profile
docs: Initializes the buddy profile of the "buddylink" user that gets automatically injected
in all new organization and in the global buddy link tree.

instructions.name: claim
docs: Claim the amounts that are claimable by the user, those amounts support multi level, meaning
the referrer will get part of the amounts.

instructions.name: no_multi_level_claim
docs: Claim the amounts that are claimable by the user, those amounts do not support multi level,
meaning the referrer doesn't get anything.

instructions.name: transfer_up
docs: This is the same as claiming, except for the claim part of the "referee". This is used
by referrer to permission-lessly claim their amounts, without having to wait for the
referee to claim. This does support multi level.

instructions.name: no_multi_level_transfer_up
docs: This is the same as claiming, except for the claim part of the "referee". This is used
by referrer to permission-lessly claim their amounts, without having to wait for the
referee to claim. This doesn't support multi level.

instructions.name: transfer_reward_nft
docs: Transfer an NFT as a reward

instructions.name: transfer_reward_no_multi_level
docs: Transfer a reward to the referrer of the member that made an activity that warrants rewards,
but is added to the no multi level amount.
Does not support global buddies
Supports SPL and SOL
Validates the accounts

instructions.name: transfer_reward_checked
docs: Transfer a reward to the referrer of the member that made an activity that warrants rewards.
Supports Global Buddies (boolean to allow or not)
Supports SPL and SOL
Validates the accounts

instructions.name: transfer_reward_global
docs: Transfer a reward to the referrer of the member that made an activity that warrants rewards,
at the global buddy level only.
Supports Global Buddies
Supports SPL and SOL
Validates the accounts

instructions.name: transfer_reward_with_bps
docs: Transfer a reward to the referrer of the member that made an activity that warrants rewards.
Only difference is you send the BPS you want to give from the amount, so if you gives
20% of your fee as reward, then you'd send 2000 bps and the full amount as arguments,
and the calculation is done for you.
Supports Global Buddies (boolean to allow or not)
Supports SPL and SOL
Validates the accounts

instructions.name: transfer_reward_spl
docs: Transfer a reward to the referrer of the member that made an activity that warrants rewards.
Supports Global Buddies (boolean to allow or not)
Supports SPL
Validates the accounts

instructions.name: transfer_reward_unchecked_multiple
docs: Transfer the reward to multiple referrer of the multiple referees. You send the shares
of each referrer as well as the total amount, and then the reward is split between
all of them.
There is a flag to say if the "member" accounts are included, which are needed
if the company wants to use on-chain analytics (rewards received), but is optional.
Does not support Global Buddies
Supports SPL and SOL
Does not validate any account

instructions.name: transfer_reward_secure_no_global
docs: Transfer a reward to the referrer of the member that made an activity that warrants rewards,
at the global buddy level only.
Does not support Global Buddies
Supports SPL
Validates the accounts (ALL OF THEM)
This is the method to use if no smart contract is used by the company and only their front
end is used.

accounts.name: to_set_version
docs: Buddy, Treasury, Organization, Member, Ambassador, AmbassadorClaimed

errors.name: NotSuperAdmin
errors.msg: Only super admin can do this action

errors.name: InvalidMasterOrganizationPubkey
errors.msg: Invalid pub key for master organization

errors.name: InvalidMasterOrganizationSolReceiverPubkey
errors.msg: Invalid pub key for master organization receiver account

errors.name: NameReservedByPaidBuddy
errors.msg: Paid buddy with this name exists

errors.name: InvalidCharacterInName
errors.msg: Only alphanumeric character are supported for the name (a-z and 0-9)

errors.name: WalletUniquenessEnforced
errors.msg: Wallet uniqueness enforced for this organization

errors.name: InvalidTokenSpecified
errors.msg: You need to specific SOL or SPL token

errors.name: NFTTokenNotBelongMint
errors.msg: NFT Token does not belong to NFT mint

errors.name: BuddyIsNotPartOfTheTreasuryOwners
errors.msg: Provided buddy not part of treasury owners

errors.name: InvalidPaidBuddyToBurn
errors.msg: Invalid paid buddy provided for metadata

errors.name: InvalidPaidBuddyName
errors.msg: Invalid paid buddy name provided for metadata

errors.name: CantCreateMemberWithReferrer
errors.msg: Can't create a member with a referrer if you don't own the buddy

errors.name: InvalidMemberForReferrer
errors.msg: Invalid member account provided for referrer

errors.name: NotAuthorizedAdmin
errors.msg: Only authorized admin can do this action

errors.name: SameAdmins
errors.msg: Authorized admins need to be different.

errors.name: DisabledMultiAttribution
errors.msg: Organization does not support multi attribution.

errors.name: BuddyShouldBeSoleOwner
errors.msg: Buddy needs to be sole owner of treasury.

errors.name: NotEnoughVolumeToClaim
errors.msg: Not enough volume to claim that amount.

errors.name: MemberNotOwnedByTreasury
errors.msg: Member is not owned by treasury.

fields.name: number_of_claimed_rewards_in_volume
docs: In case the rate of referrer volume changes, everytime a user claims, we'll calculate how much of the total referrer volume was "used" to claim
